# openDefaultApplicationsSettingsURLString

**Type Property**

The URL string used to select a default app in the Settings app.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated class let openDefaultApplicationsSettingsURLString: String
```

## Discussion

Create a URL from this value and pass it to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplication/open(_:options:completionHandler:)] method to launch the Settings app and display your app’s custom settings, if it has any:



For design guidance, see Human Interface Guidelines > [https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/].

## Deep linking to custom settings

- **openSettingsURLString**: The URL string you use to deep link to your app’s custom settings in the Settings app.
- **openNotificationSettingsURLString**: The URL string you use to deep link to your app’s notification settings in the Settings app.
- **UIApplicationOpenNotificationSettingsURLString**: A constant that provides the URL string you use to deep link to your app’s notification settings in the Settings app.
